It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Dolichostylis lindenii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and savannas.
